Title: AIRO - Interoperable Experiment Automation Package
Description:
The main goal of this project is to provide engineers and scientists flexible and extendable framework for building test, measurement and control applications. This framework is compatible with IVI-COM drivers and extends IVI Instrument Classes with custom .NET (and COM) interfaces for such devices as: step motors, different positioning devices, magnet power supplies, lock-in amplifiers etc.
We  maintain IVI Foundation's aim: "simplify upgrading or replacing components in complex test systems intended to be used over a long period of time."
The project also contains IVI-COM drivers we developed for some devices.
To access these libraries application developer can use both COM and .NET.

Project Description
The main goal of this project is to provide engineers and scientists flexible and extendable framework for building test, measurement and control applications. This framework is compatible with IVI-COM drivers and extends IVI Instrument Classes with custom .NET (and COM) interfaces for such devices as: step motors, different positioning devices, magnet power supplies, lock-in amplifiers etc.
We maintain IVI Foundation's aim: "simplify upgrading or replacing components in complex test systems intended to be used over a long period of time."
The project also contains IVI-COM drivers we developed for some devices.
To access these libraries application developer can use both COM and .NET.

Getting started with experiment automation
You can find some initial information about experiment automation in AntonF's blog: http://labsw.blogspot.com/
